quiz.title: Economics: Elasticity, Profit Maximization, and Demand

questions.question: Kyle has a preference for chickens. The owner of Chicken Republic doubles the prices of chickens. Kyle never stopped buying as many chickens as he used to. This shows that his demand is:
questions.explanation: If quantity demanded does not change at all when price doubles, demand is perfectly inelastic (price elasticity = 0).

questions.question: In the case of a straight-line demand curve meeting the two axes, the price-elasticity of demand at the mid-point of the line would be:
questions.explanation: On a linear demand curve, the midpoint corresponds to unit elasticity (|Ed| = 1). Above the midpoint, demand is elastic; below it, inelastic.

questions.question: Which of the following is the first-order condition for the profit of a firm to be maximum?
questions.explanation: Profit is maximized where marginal revenue (MR) equals marginal cost (MC), provided the MC curve cuts the MR curve from below (second-order condition).

questions.question: Price and demand are positively correlated in case of:
questions.explanation: Giffen goods are inferior goods for which demand rises when price rises, due to a strong income effect overriding the substitution effect.
